title: Imran Khan and wife face terrorism charges
byline: The Pakistani government has filed a series of charges, including one related to “terrorism”, against former Prime Minister Imran Khan, his wife, Bushra Bibi, and hundreds of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party workers after protests held in Islamabad this week.

title: New envoys present credentials to President
byline: Ten newly appointed ambassadors and one high commissioner to Sri Lanka presented their credentials to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake this morning (28) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Australia passes social media ban for children under 16
byline: Australia approved on Thursday a social media ban for children aged under 16 after an emotive debate that has gripped the nation, setting a benchmark for jurisdictions around the world with one of the toughest regulations targeting Big Tech.

title: Leopard seeks shelter from floods in Mullaitivu home
byline: A leopard that entered a house at Ilangowapuram in Mullaitivu to escape floods was captured by the Wildlife Conservation officers and released to a safer location.

title: Sri Lanka bowled out for new low against South Africa
byline: Sri Lanka were bowled out for 42, their lowest score in Test history, on the second day of the first Test against South Africa in Durban today.

title: Most beautiful elephant in Kalawewa National Park found dead
byline: Deega Danthu 1, widely regarded as the most beautiful elephant in the Kalawewa National Park, was found dead today after becoming entangled in an illegal electric fence, the National Park Warden confirmed.

title: Deega Danthu 1’s death costs Sri Lanka Rs. 90 million annually: Environmentalist
byline: The sudden death of the elephant Deega Danthu 1 has caused the country an annual loss of approximately Rs. 90 million in foreign exchange, environmentalist Nayanaka Ranwella claimed.

title: Indian Navy seizes two Sri Lankan vessels with 500kg of ICE
byline: In a coordinated operation between the Indian Navy and the Sri Lanka Navy, two Sri Lankan-flagged fishing vessels were intercepted and seized with 500 kg of narcotics (Crystal Meth) in the Indian Ocean.

title: A fatal car crash in India sparks concerns over Google Maps
byline: Can a navigation app be held responsible if a user gets into an accident? That is the question being asked in India after three men died when their car veered off an unfinished bridge and fell on to a riverbed in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh.

title: Rainy conditions to decrease from today
byline: The deep depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal, located about 240 kms northeast of Trincomalee and 290 kms east of Kankesanthurai, is expected to gradually reduce its influence on the island’s weather after today (29), the Meteorology Department said.

title: Baby elephant separated from herd finds refuge with buffaloes
byline: A wild elephant calf, which was separated from its herd due to the overflow of the Mahaweli River and the Divulana Willuwa Dam in Polonnaruwa, arrived at a cowshed in the Divulana village with a herd of buffaloes on Thursday.

title: Imran Khan and wife face terrorism charges
byline: The Pakistani government has filed a series of charges, including one related to “terrorism”, against former Prime Minister Imran Khan, his wife, Bushra Bibi, and hundreds of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party workers after protests held in Islamabad this week.

title: Australia passes social media ban for children under 16
byline: Australia approved on Thursday a social media ban for children aged under 16 after an emotive debate that has gripped the nation, setting a benchmark for jurisdictions around the world with one of the toughest regulations targeting Big Tech.

title: Injury blow for South Africa as all-rounder exits Sri Lanka series
byline: Wiaan Mulder will miss the remainder of the two-match Test series against Sri Lanka after sustaining a fractured right middle finger.

title: Applications called to appoint members to Office on Missing Persons
byline: Applications have been called for to fill the vacancies for the posts of members in the Office on Missing Persons (OMP), the Communications Department of Parliament said.

title: Cyclone Fengal forms after heavy rains lash Sri Lanka’s Northeast
byline: The deep depression that caused significant disruption in Sri Lanka’s northeastern regions over the past few days has intensified into Cyclone Fengal, according to the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: Rajarata Rejini derails
byline: The Rajarata Rejini intercity express train, traveling from Anuradhapura to Beliatta, derailed between Colombo Fort and Secretariat Halt Railway Station, the Railways Department said.

title: Air quality in SL at unhealthy level: AQI
byline: According to the real-time Air Quality Index (AQI), the air pollution level indicated in Sri Lanka’s atmosphere is still at risk and the country will experience unhealthy air quality conditions.

title: Heavy rains damage several roads, bridges: RDA to construct temporary bridges
byline: Several roads and bridges were damaged due to the adverse weather situation that prevailed during the last few days, Director General of the Road Development Authority (RDA) S.P.M. Sooriyabandara said.

title: Rajitha acquitted and released from white van press conference case
byline: The Colombo High Court today ordered the acquittal and release of two accused, including former Health Minister Rajitha Senaratne, in the controversial White Van press conference case.

title: ABBA Tribute Show: Yes, we attended, enjoyed it as people with palate for it: Tilvin
byline: In response to criticism on social media over participation in ABBA Tribute Show at Mount Lavinia Hotel, JVP General Secretary Tilvin Silva said he, along with others, attended and enjoyed it as people with a palate for enjoyment.

title: Sri Lanka records highest HIV cases in single quarter
byline: Sri Lanka has experienced a dramatic surge in HIV/AIDS cases during the second half of 2024, marking the highest number of cases logged in a single quarter since 2009.

title: Floodwaters receding, yet risk remains in some areas
byline: Floods caused by deep depression that created havoc in many parts of the country started receding today but some areas including the Northern Province are still facing risk, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said.

title: Govt. assures support for farmers affected by bad weather
byline: Farmers whose fields have been damaged by recent adverse weather conditions will be provided with full assistance to recover from the impacts, said Agriculture and Irrigation Minister K.D. Lal Kantha.

title: Chinese journalist jailed for seven years on spy charges
byline: A former Chinese state media journalist has been sentenced on Friday to seven years in prison for espionage, his family has confirmed to the BBC.

title: Parliament Secretary-General clarifies stance on perks granted to MPs
byline: Secretary-General of Parliament Kushani Rohanadeera has clarified the process and policies regarding the privileges granted to Members of Parliament (MPs) and the allocation of official residences.

title: Water cut in Colombo 12, 13, 14, 15
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced that a water cut is currently in effect in Colombo 12, 13, 14 and 15.
